text.text: How can I access the Send to Collections report?

text: To run the Send to Collections report, you can go to the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. Then, scroll down the list and click Send to Collections. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: What type of accounts does the Send to Collections report list?

text: The Send to Collections report lists accounts that have been moved to collections or state debt collections. It provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. You can run the report at the end of the month.

text.text: What detailed information does the report provide for each account?

text: The Send to Collections report provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. This includes: claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance. You can run the report at the end of the month. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting the report criteria?

text: You can select: Accounting Period or Deposit Date. You can also select Deposit Start and End Date.

text.text: How can I specify the accounting period or deposit date in the report?

text: You can select: Accounting Period or Deposit Date. You can also select Deposit Start and End Date.

text.text: When is it recommended to run the Send to Collections report?

text: It is recommended to run the report at the end of the month. You can then send the report to your collections agency or enter the claim information into your state debt programs portal.

text.text: How can I manage the information within the report?

text: To manage the information within the report, you can export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: Can I export the Send to Collections report to Excel?

text: Yes, you can export the Send to Collections report to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: What benefits does exporting the report to Excel offer?

text: You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: Where can I find the Accounts in Collections report?

text: To run the report, you can go to the navigation bar, hover over Analytics, and click Reports. Then, scroll down the list and click Accounts in Collections.

text.text: What details are included in the Accounts in Collections report?

text: The Accounts in Collections report lists all accounts currently in collections, including: Claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance.

text.text: What is the recommended frequency for using the Accounts in Collections report?

text: The recommended use is to run the report weekly.

text.text: How does the report help in managing outstanding debt and collections reconciliation?

text: The report can be used to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: Can I export the Accounts in Collections report to Excel?

text: Yes, you can export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: What insights does the report offer regarding outstanding balances and collections progress?

text: The report lists all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance.

text.text: How does the report assist in reconciling books with collections agencies or state debt programs?

text: The report can be used to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: Are there any specific tips provided for using the report effectively?

text: You can run the report at the end of the month. You can send the report to your collections agency or enter the claim information into your state debt programs portal.

text.text: How does the Accounts in Collections report integrate with the Dashboard for monitoring collection statuses?

text: The Dashboard also gives insight on the number of claim in collections and a state debt collections.

text.text: What is Send to Collections?

text: Send to Collections is a report that can be used to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program. You can run the report at the end of the month. You can send the report to your collections agency or enter the claim information into your state debt programs portal.

text.text: How to run the report in Send to Collections?

text: To run the report, you can click on the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. Then, scroll down the list and click Send to Collections. You can then select either Accounting Period or Deposit Date. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: what is the use of Send to Collections?

text: During your ongoing process, billers reviewed patient pay claims and, if needed, moved them to collections or state debt collections. The Send to Collections report lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections.

text.text: what is Accounts in Collections?

text: Accounts in Collections lists all claims sent to a collection agency or state debt collections. It can be used to view all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance.

text.text: How to run the report in Accounts in Collections?

text: To run the report, you can click on the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. Then, scroll down the list and click Accounts in Collections. You can then select Start and End Date. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: What is the use of Accounts in Collections?

text: Accounts in Collections lists all claims sent to a collection agency or state debt collections. It can be used to view all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance.

text.text: explain Number of suspended claims in state debt collections.

text: When claims are sent to state debt collections, they are automatically placed in a suspended status and given a status reason of "In state debt collections". Even though it is in state debt collections, the account remains open. If the state collects, you can post the amount to the account.
